word:
We should not talk of our own weakness and inability. This is a manifest distrust of God, a denial 
                                                                           310
of His word. When we murmur because of our burdens, or refuse the responsibilities He calls upon us to bear, we are virtually saying that He is a hard master, that He requires what He has not given us power to do.--"Christ's Object Lessons," pp. 362, 363. 

                                               -
